name: dpivision
tag_list: web-design, software, saas, business, e-commerce, xhtml, css, php, invoicing, billing
overview:
Dpivision was launched in March 2002 as a software development and web design studio specialising in the creation of engaging, functional and productive websites. Under Wladimir’s leadership, it quickly grew into a successful business and during the course of the next 8 years, developed award-winning software to enable companies to perform more efficiently online.

Dpivision secured a plethora of international clients, including office giant Regus, the European airline Flybe.com, a selection of Universities and many public sector organisations. Two strong products were developed under the Dpivision umbrella: Tradingeye, an accessible e-commerce shopping cart, and CannyBill, an invoicing and billing solution for hosting companies, which went on to secure a clutch of awards.

Tradingeye was the first shopping cart to be built using pure XHTML/CSS and comply with the W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines and Section 508. It went on to power thousands of online stores around the globe.

CannyBill was one of the first SaaS applications for web hosting companies with customers and partners, including UK2.net (one of the worldâ€™s largest hosting providers), VPS.net and SingleHop an Inc. 500 company.

In 2010, Wladimir sold Dpivision to launch his latest venture.

Dpivision was then aquired again in 2012 before being spun out under a dedicated Tradingeye brand which is still live today.

acquiring_company.name: Electronic and Mobile Commerce Software Ltd
